---
title: "Hands-on-Exercise 00: working with tidyverse"
author: "Andrea"

execute:
  echo: true
  eval: true
  warning: false
  freeze: true
---



Getting started

Load tidyverse onto r environment by using the code chunk below.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)
```
:::



importing data

code chunk below uses read_csv() of readr to import REALIS2019.csv into r environment as a tibble data frame



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
realis2019 <- read.csv("data/REALIS2019.csv")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

:::

::: {.cell}

:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata_fat <- read.csv("data/PopData2019_fat.csv")
```
:::



Pivoting data



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata_long <- popdata_fat %>%
  pivot_longer(c(3:21),
               names_to = "Age Group",
               values_to = "Population")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
write_rds(popdata_fat,"rds/popdata_fat.rds")
```
:::
